conclusion: Determine the position of the particle at t = 8 seconds using the velocity-time graph.
Initial conditions: At t = 0, the particle is at x = 5 meters and starts moving in the positive direction.
From t = 0 to t = 3 seconds, the velocity is constant and equal to 2 m/s.
From t = 3 to t = 4 seconds, the velocity is zero.
From t = 4 to t = 5 seconds, the velocity is constant and equal to -1 m/s.
From t = 5 to t = 8 seconds, the velocity is constant and equal to -1 m/s.
Calculate displacement from t = 0 to t = 3 seconds: Displacement = 6 meters; position at t = 3 seconds is x(3) = 11 meters.
Calculate displacement from t = 3 to t = 4 seconds: Displacement = 0; position at t = 4 seconds is x(4) = 11 meters.
Calculate displacement from t = 4 to t = 5 seconds: Displacement = -1 meter; position at t = 5 seconds is x(5) = 10 meters.
Calculate displacement from t = 5 to t = 8 seconds: Displacement = -3 meters; position at t = 8 seconds is x(8) = 7 meters.
Final answer: The position of the particle on the x-axis at t = 8 seconds is 7 meters.
